member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_XFERCOUNT
member.summary: The application is willing to accept this number of images.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_COMPRESSION
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which compression schemes they have in common for Buffered Memory and File transfers.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PIXELTYPE
member.summary: The type of pixel data that a Source is capable of acquiring (for example, black and white, gray, RGB, etc.).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_UNITS
member.summary: Unless a quantity is dimensionless or uses a specified unit of measure, ICAP_UNITS determines the unit of measure for all quantities.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_XFERMECH
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which transfer mechanisms the source supports.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_AUTHOR
member.summary: The name or other identifying information about the Author of the image. It may include a copyright string.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CAPTION
member.summary: A general note about the acquired image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDERENABLED
member.summary: If TRUE, Source must acquire data from the document feeder acquire area and other feeder capabilities can be used. If FALSE, Source must acquire data from the non-feeder acquire area and no other feeder capabilities can be used.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDERLOADED
member.summary: Reflect whether there are documents loaded in the Sources feeder.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_TIMEDATE
member.summary: The date and time the image was acquired.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPS
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries. Does not indicate which capabilities the Source will allow to be set by the application. Some capabilities can only be set if certain setup work has been done so the Source cannot globally answer which capabilities are set-able.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_EXTENDEDCAPS
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to negotiate capabilities to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_AUTOFEED
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will automatically feed the next page from the document feeder after the number of frames negotiated for capture from each page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must be TRUE to use this capability.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CLEARPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page being acquired from and will leave the feeder acquire area empty. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, a fresh page will be advanced. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page and advance the next page in the document feeder into the feeder acquire area. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, the same action just described will occur and CAP_AUTOFEED will remain active. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_REWINDPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will return the current page to the input side of the document feeder and feed the last page from the output side of the feeder back into the acquisition area. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, automatic feeding will continue after all negotiated frames from this page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_INDICATORS
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source displays a progress indicator during acquisition and transfer, regardless of whether the Source's user interface is active. If FALSE, the progress indicator is suppressed if the Source's user interface is inactive. The Source displays device-specific instructions and error messages if either the user interface or progress indicator is turned on. In this case it returns TWCC_OPERATIONERROR to alert the application that it handled the error, and communicated the problem to the user. If both the user interface and progress indicator are turned off, then the Source never displays any message to the user, even if TWCC_OPERATIONERROR is returned. Messages to the user are under the sole control of the Application.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PAPERDETECTABLE
member.summary: This capability determines whether the device has a paper sensor that can detect documents on the ADF or Flatbed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_UICONTROLLABLE
member.summary: If TRUE, indicates that this Source supports acquisition with the UI disabled; i.e., TW_USERINTERFACEs ShowUI field can be set to FALSE. If FALSE, indicates that this Source can only support acquisition with the UI enabled.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DEVICEONLINE
member.summary: If TRUE, the physical hardware (e.g., scanner, digital camera, image database, etc.) that represents the image source is attached, powered on, and communicating.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_AUTOSCAN
member.summary: This capability is intended to boost the performance of a Source. The fundamental assumption behind AutoScan is that the device is able to capture the number of images indicated by the value of CAP_XFERCOUNT without waiting for the Application to request the image transfers. This is only possible if the device has internal buffers capable of caching the images it captures. The default behavior is undefined, because some high volume devices are incapable of anything but CAP_AUTOSCAN being equal to TRUE. However, if a Source supports FALSE, it should use it as the mandatory default, since this best describes the behavior of pre-1.8 TWAIN Applications.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED
member.summary: Allows an application to request the delivery of thumbnail representations for the set of images that are to be delivered. Setting CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED to TRUE turns on thumbnail mode. Images transferred thereafter will be sent at thumbnail size (exact thumbnail size is determined by the Data Source). Setting this capability to FALSE turns thumbnail mode off and returns full size images.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DUPLEX
member.summary: This indicates whether the scanner supports duplex. If so, it further indicates whether one-path or two-path duplex is supported.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DUPLEXENABLED
member.summary: The user can set the duplex option to be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, the scanner scans both sides of a paper; otherwise, the scanner will scan only one side of the image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_ENABLEDSUIONLY
member.summary: Allows an application to query a source to see if it implements the new user interface settings dialog. If a source reports that it has the capability CAP_ENABLEDSUIONLY, then it must implement the operation triplet DG_CONTROL/ DAT_USERINTERFACE/ MSG_ENABLEDSUIONLY to display the source user interface without acquiring an image. If TRUE, the source will support the DG_CONTROL/ DAT_USERINTERFACE / MSG_ENABLEDSUIONLY message.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CUSTOMDSDATA
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports the new operation triplets DG_CONTROL/ DAT_CUSTOMDSDATA / MSG_GET and DG_CONTROL/ DAT_CUSTOMDSDATA / MSG_SET. If TRUE, the source will support the DG_CONTROL/ DAT_CUSTOMDSDATA/MSG_GET message.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_ENDORSER
member.summary: Allows the application to specify the starting endorser / imprinter number. All other endorser/ imprinter properties should be handled through the data sources user interface. The user can set the starting number for the endorser.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_JOBCONTROL
member.summary: Allows multiple jobs in batch mode. The application can decide how the job can be processed, according to the flags listed below.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_ALARMS
member.summary: Turns specific audible alarms on and off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_ALARMVOLUME
member.summary: The volume of a devices audible alarm. Note that this control affects the volume of all alarms; no specific volume control for individual types of alarms is provided.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_AUTOMATICCAPTURE
member.summary: The number of images to automatically capture. This does not refer to the number of images to be sent to the Application, use CAP_XFERCOUNT for that.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_TIMEBEFOREFIRSTCAPTURE
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the number of milliseconds before the first picture is to be taken, or the first image is to be scanned.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_TIMEBETWEENCAPTURES
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the milliseconds to wait between pictures taken, or images scanned.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CLEARBUFFERS
member.summary: MSG_GET reports the presence of data in the scanners buffers. MSG_SET with a value of TWCB_CLEAR immediately clears the buffers.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_MAXBATCHBUFFERS
member.summary: Describes the number of pages that the scanner can buffer when CAP_AUTOSCAN is enabled.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DEVICETIMEDATE
member.summary: The date and time of the devices clock. Managed in the form YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:SS:sss where YYYY is the year, MM is the numerical month, DD is the numerical day, HH is the hour, mm is the minute, SS is the second, and sss is the millisecond.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_POWERSUPPLY
member.summary: MSG_GET reports the kinds of power available to the device. MSG_GETCURRENT reports the current power supply in use.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CAMERAPREVIEWUI
member.summary: This capability queries the Source for UI support for preview mode. If TRUE, the Source supports preview UI.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DEVICEEVENT
member.summary: MSG_SET selects which events the Application wants the Source to report. MSG_GET and MSG_GETCURRENT gets the current setting. MSG_RESET resets the capability to the empty array (no events set).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_SERIALNUMBER
member.summary: A string containing the serial number of the currently selected device in the Source. Multiple devices may all report the same serial number.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTER
member.summary: MSG_GET returns the current list of available printer devices, along with the one currently being used for negotiation. MSG_SET selects the current device for negotiation, and optionally constrains the list. MSG_RESET restores all the available devices (useful after MSG_SET has been used to constrain the list). Top/Bottom refer to duplex devices, and indicate if the printer is writing on the top or the bottom of the sheet of paper. Simplex devices use the top settings. Before/After indicates whether printing occurs before or after the sheet of paper has been scanned.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTERENABLED
member.summary: Turns the current CAP_PRINTER device on or off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTERINDEX
member.summary: The User can set the starting number for the current CAP_PRINTER device.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTERMODE
member.summary: Specifies the appropriate current CAP_PRINTER device mode.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTERSTRING
member.summary: Specifies the string(s) that are to be used in the string component when the current CAP_PRINTER device is enabled.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTERSUFFIX
member.summary: Specifies the string that shall be used as the current CAP_PRINTER devices suffix.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_LANGUAGE
member.summary: Allows Application and Source to identify which languages they have in common for the exchange of string data, and to select the language of the internal UI.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT
member.summary: Helps the Application determine any special actions it may need to take when negotiating frames with the Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDERORDER
member.summary: Determine if it should reorganize the stream of images received from a Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_REACQUIREALLOWED
member.summary: Indicates whether the physical hardware (e.g. scanner, digital camera) is capable of acquiring multiple images of the same page without changes to the physical registration of that page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_BATTERYMINUTES
member.summary: The minutes of battery power remaining to the device.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_BATTERYPERCENTAGE
member.summary: When used with MSG_GET, return the percentage of battery power level on camera. If -1 is returned, it indicates that the battery is not present.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CAMERASIDE
member.summary: TWAIN models a duplex scanner as conceptually having two 'cameras' - a 'top' camera that captures the front of each page, and a 'bottom' camera that captures the back. Some devices allow these two logical cameras to operate with different settings for certain capabilities. CAP_CAMERASIDE provides a simple way to address the cameras individually: The value of CAP_CAMERASIDE determines whether subsequent capability negotiation is directed to one camera or the other, or to both.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_SEGMENTED
member.summary: Describes the segmentation setting for captured images. Image segmentation occurs when either the device, the Source or the Application breaks up an image into a stream of image components (text, pictures, graphics) that must be assembled by the application to reconstruct the original document. Applications must use the DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO / TWEI_SEGMENTNUMBER field to identify pieces of an image that are associated with each other through segmentation. Manual segmentation is an advanced way of setting the Source to transfer image components with different parameters from the same page. Not all Sources support this feature.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CAMERAENABLED
member.summary: This feature depends on camera addressing, which is the ability to address elements in the device responsible for the color space or location. TWAIN offers DAT_FILESYSTEM and CAP_CAMERASIDE to do this. When set to TRUE the device will deliver images from the current camera. The Current Camera can be selected with either CAP_CAMERASIDE or DAT_FILESYSTEM. With CAP_CAMERASIDE it is possible to enable bottom (rear) only scanning, or have different settings for top and bottom. With DAT_FILESYSTEM it is possible to enter a Single Document Multiple Images (SDMI) mode in addition to enabling different settings for top and bottom.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CAMERAORDER
member.summary: This capability selects the order of output for Single Document Multiple Image (SDMI) mode based on an array of pixel types; it does not constrain the allowed pixel types. For example, if the scanner is set up to deliver color and bitonal documents on the top (front) camera, then an array of {TWPT_RGB, TWPT_BW} will deliver first the color image, then the bitonal image, while an array of {TWPT_BW, TWPT_RGB} will deliver first the bitonal image, then the color image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_MICRENABLED
member.summary: Get this capability to determine if the Source supports check scanning. If set to TRUE check scanning is enabled, if set to FALSE check scanning is disabled.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDERPREP
member.summary: Improve the movement of paper through a scanner ADF.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_FEEDERPOCKET
member.summary: Report what pockets are available to receive paper as it exits from the device.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_AUTOMATICSENSEMEDIUM
member.summary: Configures a Source to check for paper in the Automatic Document Feeder, and if it finds any, then automatically capture all of its images from the Feeder. If the Feeder is empty when acquisition starts, then all images are automatically captured from the Flatbed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_CUSTOMINTERFACEGUID
member.summary: Uniquely identifies an interface for a Data Source, so that an Application can properly interpret its custom content.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPSSEGMENTUNIQUE
member.summary: For Sources that allow unique values to be set for things like the top and bottom or for each segment on a page. Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source allows to have unique values.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_SUPPORTEDDATS
member.summary: Returns a list of all the Data Argument Types (DAT_xxx) for which the Source will answer inquiries. This list does not indicate which DATs the Source will allow to be set by the application. Some DATs can only be set if certain setup work has been done so the Source cannot globally answer which DATs are set-able. HIWORD of the value is DG of DAT. LOWORD of the value is the DAT itself.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION
member.summary: Enables or disables double feed detection.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONLENGTH
member.summary: When CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION includes TWDF_BYLENGTH, it allows an Application to set the minimum length for detecting double feed documents. A value of zero always means off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONSENSITIVITY
member.summary: When CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION includes TWDF_ULTRASONIC, allows an Application to set how sensitive the double feed detection is.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONRESPONSE
member.summary: When CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION is set to anything but Disabled, it allows an Application to set how the source will respond to detecting a double feed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PAPERHANDLING
member.summary: Use this capability to control paper handling. This capability may affect scanning speed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_INDICATORSMODE
member.summary: Specify what messages can be displayed if ICAP_INDICATORS is TRUE.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_PRINTERVERTICALOFFSET
member.summary: Specifies a Y-Offset in ICAP_UNITS units for the current CAP_PRINTER device.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.CAP_POWERSAVETIME
member.summary: When used with MSG_SET, set the camera power down timer in seconds. When used with MSG_GET, return the current setting of the power down time.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOBRIGHT
member.summary: TRUE enables and FALSE disables the Sources Auto-brightness function (if any).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BRIGHTNESS
member.summary: The brightness values available within the Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_CONTRAST
member.summary: The contrast values available within the Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_CUSTHALFTONE
member.summary: Specifies the square-cell halftone (dithering) matrix the Source should use to halftone the image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_EXPOSURETIME
member.summary: Specifies the exposure time used to capture the image, in seconds.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FILTER
member.summary: Describes the color characteristic of the subtractive filter applied to the image data. Multiple filters may be applied to a single acquisition. If the Source supports DAT_FILTER as well, then it will apply the filter set by the last SET operation invoked by the Application. Setting/Resetting ICAP_FILTER will clear the filter associated with DAT_FILTER. Setting/Resetting DAT_FILTER will clear the filter associated with ICAP_FILTER.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FLASHUSED
member.summary: For devices that support flash. MSG_SET selects the flash to be used (if any). MSG_GET reports the current setting. This capability replaces ICAP_FLASHUSED, which is only able to negotiate the flash being on or off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_GAMMA
member.summary: Gamma correction value for the image data.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_HAFTTONES
member.summary: A list of names of the halftone patterns available within the Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_HIGHLIGHT
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the lightest highlight. All values lighter than this value will be clipped to this value. Whether lighter values are smaller or larger can be determined by examining the Current value of ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT
member.summary: Informs the application which file formats the Source can generate (MSG_GET). Tells the Source which file formats the application can handle (MSG_SET).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_LAMPSTATE
member.summary: TRUE means the lamp is currently, or should be set to ON. Sources may not support MSG_SET operations.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_LIGHTSOURCE
member.summary: Describes the general color characteristic of the light source used to acquire the image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Defines which edge of the paper the images top is aligned with. This information is used to adjust the frames to match the scanning orientation of the paper. For instance, if an ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZE of TWSS_ISOA4 has been negotiated, and ICAP_ORIENTATION is set to TWOR_LANDSCAPE, then the Source must rotate the frame it downloads to the scanner to reflect the orientation of the paper.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH
member.summary: The maximum physical width (X-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of ICAP_UNITS).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT
member.summary: The maximum physical height (Y-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of ICAP_UNITS).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_SHADOW
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the darkest shadow. All values darker than this value will be clipped to this value.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FRAMES
member.summary: The list of frames the Source will acquire on each page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_XNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the X-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Most devices will respond with a single value (TW_ONEVALUE). This is NOT a list of all resolutions that can be generated by the device. Rather, this is the resolution of the devices optics. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_YNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the Y-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_XRESOLUTION
member.summary: All the X-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_YRESOLUTION
member.summary: All the Y-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_MAXFRAMES
member.summary: The maximum number of frames the Source can provide or the application can accept per page. This is a bounding capability only. It does not establish current or future behavior.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_TILES
member.summary: This is used with buffered memory transfers. If TRUE, Source can provide application with tiled image data.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BITORDER
member.summary: Specifies how the bytes in an image are filled by the Source. TWBO_MSBFIRST indicates that the leftmost bit in the byte (usually bit 7) is the bytes Most Significant Bit.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_CCITTKFACTOR
member.summary: Used for CCITT Group 3 2-dimensional compression. The K factor indicates how often the new compression baseline should be re-established. A value of 2 or 4 is common in facsimile communication. A value of zero in this field will indicate an infinite K factorthe baseline is only calculated at the beginning of the transfer.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_LIGHTPATH
member.summary: Describes whether the image was captured transmissively or reflectively.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR
member.summary: Sense of the pixel whose numeric value is zero (minimum data value).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PLANARCHUNKY
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which color data formats are available. There are two options, planar and chunky. For example, planar RGB data is transferred with the entire red plane of data first, followed by the entire green plane, followed by the entire blue plane (typical for three-pass scanners). Chunky mode repetitively interlaces a pixel from each plane until all the data is transferred (R-G-B-R-GB) (typical for one-pass scanners).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_ROTATION
member.summary: How the Source can/should rotate the scanned image data prior to transfer. This doesnt use ICAP_UNITS. It is always measured in degrees. Any applied value is additive with any rotation specified in ICAP_ORIENTATION.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES
member.summary: For devices that support fixed frame sizes. Defined sizes match typical page sizes. This specifies the size(s) the Source can/should use to acquire image data.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Specifies the dividing line between black and white. This is the value the Source will use to threshold, if needed, when ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW. The value is normalized so there are no units of measure associated with this ICAP.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_XSCALING
member.summary: All the X-axis scaling values available. A value of 1.0 is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_YSCALING
member.summary: All the Y-axis scaling values available. A value of 1.0 is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero. There are no units inherent with this data as it is normalized to 1.0 being unscaled.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BITORDERCODES
member.summary: Used for CCITT data compression only. Indicates the bit order representation of the stored compressed codes.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PIXELFLAVORCODES
member.summary: Used only for CCITT data compression. Specifies whether the compressed codes pixel sense will be inverted from the Current value of ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR prior to transfer.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_JPEGPIXELTYPE
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to agree upon a common set of color descriptors that are made available by the Source. This ICAP is only useful for JPEG-compressed buffered memory image transfers.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_TIMEFILL
member.summary: Used only with CCITT data compression. Specifies the minimum number of words of compressed codes (compressed data) to be transmitted per line.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BITDEPTH
member.summary: Specifies the pixel bit depths for the Current value of ICAP_PIXELTYPE.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BITDEPTHREDUCTION
member.summary: Specifies the Reduction Method the Source should use to reduce the bit depth of the data. Most commonly used with ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW to reduce gray data to black and white.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_UNDEFINEDIMAGESIZE
member.summary: If TRUE the Source will issue a MSG_XFERREADY before starting the scan.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_IMAGEDATASET
member.summary: Gets or sets the image indices that will be delivered during the standard image transfer done in States 6 and 7. Indices are assumed to start at 1, so a TW_ONEVALUE container sets an implied range from 1 to the number specified. TW_RANGE returns are useful for those cases where the images are contiguous (5 .. 36). TW_ARRAY returns should be used were index values are discontinuous (as could be the case where the user previously set such a data set).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_EXTIMAGEINFO
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports the operation triplet DG_IMAGE / DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO / MSG_GET. Support is only available if the capability is supported and the value TRUE is allowed. When set to TRUE, the source supports the DG_IMAGE / DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO / MSG_GET message, and data will be returned by this call for any supported TWEI_ items. When set to FALSE, the application is indicating that it will make no calls to DG_IMAGE / DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO/ MSG_GET. FALSE is the default.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_MINIMUMHEIGHT
member.summary: Allows the source to define the minimum height (Y-axis) that the source can acquire.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_MINIMUMWIDTH
member.summary: Allows the source to define the minimum width (X-axis) that the source can acquire.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTODISCARDBLANKPAGES
member.summary: Use this capability to have the Source discard blank images. The Application never sees these images during the scanning session. TWBP_DISABLE this must be the default state for the Source. It indicates that all images will be delivered to the Application, none of them will be discarded. TWBP_AUTO if this is used, then the Source will decide if an image is blank or not and discard as appropriate. If the specified value is a positive number in the range 0 to 2311, then this capability will use it as the byte size cutoff point to identify which images are to be discarded. If the size of the image is less than or equal to this value, then it will be discarded. If the size of the image is greater than this value, then it will be kept so that it can be transferred to the Application.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FLIPROTATION
member.summary: Flip rotation is used to properly orient images that flip orientation every other image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BARCODEDETECTIONENABLED
member.summary: Turns bar code detection on and off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_SUPPORTEDBARCODETYPES
member.summary: Provides a list of bar code types that can be detected by the current Data Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BARCODEMAXSEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: The maximum number of supported search priorities.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BARCODESEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: A prioritized list of bar code types dictating the order in which bar codes will be sought.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BARCODESEARCHMODE
member.summary: Restricts bar code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BARCODEMAXRETRIES
member.summary: Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_BARCODETIMEOUT
member.summary: Restricts the total time spent on searching for a bar code on each page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_ZOOMFACTOR
member.summary: When used with MSG_GET, return all camera supported lens zooming range.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PATCHCODEDETECTIONENABLED
member.summary: Turns patch code detection on and off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_SUPPORTEDPATCHCODETYPES
member.summary: A list of patch code types that may be detected by the current Data Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PATCHCODEMAXSEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: The maximum number of supported search priorities.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PATCHCODESEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: A prioritized list of patch code types dictating the order in which patch codes will be sought.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PATCHCODESEARCHMODE
member.summary: Restricts patch code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PATCHCODEMAXRETRIES
member.summary: Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_PATCHCODETIMEOUT
member.summary: Restricts the total time spent on searching for a patch code on each page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FLASHUSED2
member.summary: For devices that support flash. MSG_SET selects the flash to be used (if any). MSG_GET reports the current setting. This capability replaces ICAP_FLASHUSED, which is only able to negotiate the flash being on or off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_IMAGEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support image enhancement filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to improve the quality of the image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_NOISEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support noise filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to remove noise.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_OVERSCAN
member.summary: Overscan is used to scan outside of the boundaries described by ICAP_FRAMES, and is used to help acquire image data that may be lost because of skewing.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICBORDERDETECTION
member.summary: Turns automatic border detection on and off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICDESKEW
member.summary: Turns automatic deskew correction on and off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICROTATE
member.summary: When TRUE this capability depends on intelligent features within the Source to automatically rotate the image to the correct position.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_JPEGQUALITY
member.summary: Use this capability as a shortcut to select JPEG quantization tables that tradeoff quality versus compressed image size. Used in concert with DAT_JPEGCOMPRSSION it is possible for an Application to obtain the tables that are appropriate for varying percentages of quality within a given Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FEEDERTYPE
member.summary: Allows the Application to set scan parameters depending upon the type of feeder. If the Source has a general type of the feeder only, default scan parameters can depend upon the type of scan (general document or photo). In this case, negotiating this capability will allow the Source adjusting the settings accordingly. It is advised, therefore, that this capability be negotiated prior to the capabilities related to specific Source settings (like ICAP_*RESOLUTION, ICAP_PIXELTYPE, etc.) but after the other feeder-related capabilities (CAP_FEEDERENABLED, CAP_FEEDERLOADED).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_ICCPROFILE
member.summary: Informs the application if the source has an ICC profile and can embed or link it in the current ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT. Tells the source if the application would like an ICC profile embedded or linked into the image file the source will write.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOSIZE
member.summary: Force the output image dimensions to match either the current value of ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES or any of its current allowed values.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICCROPUSESFRAME
member.summary: Set TRUE if DAT_IMAGELAYOUT, ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES or ICAP_FRAMES reduces the amount of data captured from the device, potentially improving the performance of the driver, even if any automatic detection capability like ICAP_AUTOMATICBORDERDECTION is set TRUE.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICLENGTHDETECTION
member.summary: Controls the automatic detection of the length of a document, this is intended for use with an Automatic Document Feeder.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORENABLED
member.summary: The Source automatically detects the pixel type of the image and returns either a color image or a non-color image specified by ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORNONCOLORPIXELTYPE.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORNONCOLORPIXELTYPE
member.summary: Specifies the non-color pixel type to use when automatic color is enabled.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_COLORMANAGEMENTENABLED
member.summary: Disables the Sources color and gamma tables for color and grayscale images, resulting in output that that could be termed raw.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_IMAGEMERGE
member.summary: Merges the front and rear image of a document in one of four orientations: front on the top, front on the bottom, front on the left or front on the right.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_IMAGEMERGEHEIGHTTHRESHOLD
member.summary: Specifies a Y-Offset in ICAP_UNITS units. Front and rear images less than or equal to this value are merged according to the settings of ICAP_IMAGEMERGE. If either the front or the rear image is greater than this value, they are not merged.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_SUPPORTEDEXTIMAGEINFO
member.summary: Lists all of the information that the Source is capable of returning from a call to DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_FILMTYPE
member.summary: When ICAP_LIGHTPATH is set to TWLP_TRANSMISSIVE it allows an Application to set what kind of film is being scanned.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_MIRROR
member.summary: How the Source can/should mirror the scanned image data prior to transfer. Operation is performed in conjunction with ICAP_ORIENTATION and ICAP_ROTATION.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ICAP_JPEGSUBSAMPLING
member.summary: Use this capability and ICAP_JPEGQUALITY as a shortcut to select JPEG quantization. Used in concert with DAT_JPEGCOMPRSSION it is possible for an Application to obtain the tables that are appropriate for varying percentages of quality within a given Source. It has meaning for color images only.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAPABILITIES.ACAP_XFERMECH
member.summary: Allows the Application and Source to identify which audio transfer mechanisms they have in common.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_JOBCONTROL
member.summary: Allows multiple jobs in batch mode. The application can decide how the job can be processed, according to the flags listed below.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_JOBCONTROL.TWJC_JSIC
member.summary: Detect and include job separator and continue scanning.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_JOBCONTROL.TWJC_JSIS
member.summary: Detect and include job separator and stop scanning.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_JOBCONTROL.TWJC_JSXC
member.summary: Detect and exclude job separator and continue scanning.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_JOBCONTROL.TWJC_JSXS
member.summary: Detect and exclude job separator and stop scanning.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_ALARMS
member.summary: Turns specific audible alarms on and off.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_ALARMS.TWAL_ALARM
member.summary: Is a catchall for alarms not explicitly listed. It is also used where a device only provides control over a single, multi-use alarm. For instance, if a device beeps for both jams and bar-codes, but doesnt allow independent control of the alarms, then it should report TWAL_ALARM to cover them, and not TWAL_BARCODE, TWAL_JAM.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_ALARMS.TWAL_FEEDERERROR
member.summary: Covers paper handling errors such as jams, double-feeds, skewing and the like; conditions that most likely stop scanning.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_ALARMS.TWAL_FEEDERWARNING
member.summary: Covers non-fatal events, such as feeder empty.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_ALARMS.TWAL_PATCHCODE
member.summary: Generate alarms when an image with this kind of data is recognized.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_ALARMS.TWAL_POWER
member.summary: Generates alarms for any changes in power to the device.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_CAMERASIDE
member.summary: Sets the top and bottom values of cameras in a scanning device.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_CLEARBUFFERS
member.summary: MSG_GET reports presence of data in scanners buffers; MSG_SET clears the buffers.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT
member.summary: MSG_SET selects which events the Application wants the Source to report. MSG_GET and MSG_GETCURRENT gets the current setting. MSG_RESET resets the capability to the empty array (no events set).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CUSTOMEVENTS
member.summary: Baseline for events specific to a given Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CHECKAUTOMATICCAPTURE
member.summary: The automatic capture settings on the device have been changed by the user.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CHECKBATTERY
member.summary: The status of the battery has changed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CHECKDEVICEONLINE
member.summary: The device has been turned off and on.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CHECKFLASH
member.summary: The flash setting on the device has been changed by the user.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CHECKPOWERSUPPLY
member.summary: The power supply has been changed (for instance, the user may have just connected AC to a device that was running on battery power).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_CHECKRESOLUTION
member.summary: The x/y resolution setting on the device has been changed by the user.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_DEVICEADDED
member.summary: The user has added a device (for instance a memory card in a digital camera).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_DEVICEOFFLINE
member.summary: A device has become unavailable, but has not been removed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_DEVICEREADY
member.summary: The device is ready to capture an image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_DEVICEREMOVED
member.summary: The user has removed a device.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_IMAGECAPTURED
member.summary: The user has captured an image to the devices internal storage.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_IMAGEDELETED
member.summary: The user has removed an image from the devices internal storage.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_PAPERDOUBLEFEED
member.summary: Two or more sheets of paper have been fed together.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_PAPERJAM
member.summary: The devices document feeder has jammed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_LAMPFAILURE
member.summary: The devices light source has failed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_POWERSAVE
member.summary: The device has powered down to save energy.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DEVICEEVENT.TWDE_POWERSAVENOTIFY

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT
member.summary: Helps the Application determine any special actions it may need to take when negotiating frames with the Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT.TWFA_NONE
member.summary: The alignment is free-floating. Applications should assume that the origin for frames is on the left.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT.TWFA_LEFT
member.summary: The alignment is to the left.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT.TWFA_CENTER
member.summary: The alignment is centered. This means that the paper will be fed in the middle of the ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH of the device. If this is set, then the Application should calculate any frames with a left offset.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT.TWFA_RIGHT
member.summary: The alignment is to the right. If this is set, then the Application should calculate any frames with a left offset.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERORDER
member.summary: Determine if it should reorganize the stream of images received from a Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERORDER.TWFO_FIRSTPAGEFIRST
member.summary: The feeder starts with the top of the first page.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERORDER.TWFO_LASTPAGEFIRST
member.summary: The feeder starts with the top of the last page.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_FEEDERPOCKET
member.summary: Report what pockets are available to receive paper as it exits from the device.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_POWERSUPPLY
member.summary: MSG_GET reports the kinds of power available to the device. MSG_GETCURRENT reports the current power supply in use.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_PRINTER
member.summary: MSG_GET returns the current list of available printer devices, along with the one currently being used for negotiation. MSG_SET selects the current device for negotiation, and optionally constrains the list. MSG_RESET restores all the available devices (useful after MSG_SET has been used to constrain the list).

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_PRINTERMODE
member.summary: Specifies the appropriate current CAP_PRINTER device mode.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_PRINTERMODE.TWPM_SINGLESTRING
member.summary: Specifies that the printed text will consist of a single string.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_PRINTERMODE.TWPM_MULTISTRING
member.summary: Specifies that the printed text will consist of an enumerated list of strings to be printed in order.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_PRINTERMODE.TWPM_COMPOUNDSTRING
member.summary: Specifies that the printed string will consist of a compound of a String followed by a value followed by a suffix string.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_SEGMENTED
member.summary: Describes the segmentation setting for captured images.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DUPLEX
member.summary: This indicates whether the scanner supports duplex. If so, it further indicates whether one-path or two-path duplex is supported.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION
member.summary: Enables or disables double feed detection.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONRESPONSE
member.summary: When CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION is set to anything but Disabled, it allows an Application to set how the source will respond to detecting a double feed.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONRESPONSE.TWDP_STOP
member.summary: When a multi-feed is detected the driver must end the scanner session, returning TWCC_PAPERDOUBLEFEED for the an DAT_IMAGE*XFER call that applied to the bad image.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONRESPONSE.TWDP_STOPANDWAIT
member.summary: The driver/device will manage the multi-feed; the application is not notified; after the problem is fixed by the operator, image capture is continued as if no multifeed occurred.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONRESPONSE.TWDP_SOUND
member.summary: The driver/device will generate an audible alert when a multi-feed is detected

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONRESPONSE.TWDP_DONOTIMPRINT
member.summary: the device will not print on multi-fed documents. All combinations are valid, excluding TWDP_STOP and TWDP_STOPANDWAIT as only one of those can appear at a time. If the driver is asked for both, it may pick one and return TWRC_CHECKSTATUS.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONSENSITIVITY
member.summary: When CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTION includes TWDF_ULTRASONIC, allows an Application to set how sensitive the double feed detection is.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_DOUBLEFEEDDETECTIONSENSITIVITY.TWDP_DONOTIMPRINT
member.summary: Do not imprint double feed sensitivity.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_INDICATORSMODE
member.summary: Specify what messages can be displayed if ICAP_INDICATORS is TRUE.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.CAP_PAPERHANDLING
member.summary: Use this capability to control paper handling. This capability may affect scanning speed.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_FEEDERTYPE
member.summary: Allows the Application to set scan parameters depending upon the type of feeder. If the Source has a general type of the feeder only, default scan parameters can depend upon the type of scan (general document or photo). In this case, negotiating this capability will allow the Source adjusting the settings accordingly. It is advised, therefore, that this capability be negotiated prior to the capabilities related to specific Source settings (like ICAP_*RESOLUTION, ICAP_PIXELTYPE, etc.) but after the other feeder-related capabilities (CAP_FEEDERENABLED, CAP_FEEDERLOADED).

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_FILTER
member.summary: Describes the color characteristic of the subtractive filter applied to the image data. Multiple filters may be applied to a single acquisition. If the Source supports DAT_FILTER as well, then it will apply the filter set by the last SET operation invoked by the Application. Setting/Resetting ICAP_FILTER will clear the filter associated with DAT_FILTER. Setting/Resetting DAT_FILTER will clear the filter associated with

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_LIGHTPATH
member.summary: Describes whether the image was captured transmissively or reflectively.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_LIGHTSOURCE
member.summary: Describes the general color characteristic of the light source used to acquire the image.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_PLANARCHUNKY
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which color data formats are available.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR
member.summary: Sense of the pixel whose numeric value is zero (minimum data value).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR.CHOCOLATE
member.summary: This pixel represents the darkest data value that can be generated by the device (the darkest available optical value may measure greater than 0).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR.VANILLA
member.summary: This pixel represents the lightest data value that can be generated by the device (the lightest available optical value may measure greater than 0).

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_BITDEPTHREDUCTION
member.summary: Specifies the Reduction Method the Source should use to reduce the bit depth of the data. Most commonly used with ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW to reduce gray data to black and white.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_SUPPORTEDBARCODETYPES
member.summary: Provides a list of bar code types that can be detected by the current Data Source.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_SUPPORTEDBARCODETYPES.TWBT_CODABARWITHSTARTSTOP
member.summary: Codabar with start stop bacode type.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_AUTODISCARDBLANKPAGES
member.summary: Use this capability to have the Source discard blank images. The Application never sees these images during the scanning session.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_AUTOSIZE
member.summary: Force the output image dimensions to match either the current value of ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES or any of its current allowed values.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_BITORDER
member.summary: Specifies how the bytes in an image are filled by the Source. TWBO_MSBFIRST indicates that the leftmost bit in the byte (usually bit 7) is the bytes Most Significant Bit.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_ICCPROFILE
member.summary: Informs the application if the source has an ICC profile and can embed or link it in the current ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT. Tells the source if the application would like an ICC profile embedded or linked into the image file the source will write.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_BARCODESEARCHMODE
member.summary: Restricts bar code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_FLASHUSED2
member.summary: For devices that support a flash, MSG_SET selects the flash to be used; MSG_GET reports the current setting.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_FILMTYPE
member.summary: When ICAP_LIGHTPATH is set to TWLP_TRANSMISSIVE it allows an Application to set what kind of film is being scanned.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEMERGE
member.summary: Merges the front and rear image of a document in one of four orientations: front on the top.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_NOISEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support noise filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to remove noise.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_OVERSCAN
member.summary: Overscan is used to scan outside of the boundaries described by ICAP_FRAMES, and is used to help acquire image data that may be lost because of skewing.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_FLIPROTATION
member.summary: Flip rotation is used to properly orient images that flip orientation every other image.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT
member.summary: Informs the application which file formats the Source can generate (MSG_GET). Tells the Source which file formats the application can handle (MSG_SET).

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.TIFF
member.summary: Used for document imaging. Native Linux format.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.PNG
member.summary: An image format standard intended for use on the web, replaces GIF

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.SPIFF
member.summary: A standard from JPEG, intended to replace JFIF, also supports JBIG

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.EXIF
member.summary: File format for use with digital cameras.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.JP2
member.summary: A file format from the Joint Photographic Experts Group ISO/IEC 15444-1

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.JPX
member.summary: A file format from the Joint Photographic Experts Group ISO/IEC 15444-2

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.PDFA
member.summary: A file format from Adobe PDF/A, Version 1

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.PDFA2
member.summary: A file format from Adobe PDF/A, Version 2

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Defines which edge of the paper the images top is aligned with. This information is used to adjust the frames to match the scanning orientation of the paper.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES
member.summary: For devices that support fixed frame sizes. Defined sizes match typical page sizes. This specifies the size(s) the Source can/should use to acquire image data.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_PIXELTYPE
member.summary: The type of pixel data that a Source is capable of acquiring (for example, black and white, gray, RGB, etc.).

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_JPEGPIXELTYPE
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to agree upon a common set of color descriptors that are made available by the Source. This ICAP is only useful for JPEG-compressed buffered memory image transfers.

member.name: F:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_JPEGPIXELTYPE.BW
member.summary: Black and white JPG pixel type.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_JPEGSUBSAMPLING
member.summary: Use this capability and ICAP_JPEGQUALITY as a shortcut to select JPEG quantization. Used in concert with DAT_JPEGCOMPRSSION it is possible for an Application to obtain the tables that are appropriate for varying percentages of quality within a given Source. It has meaning for color images only.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_MIRROR
member.summary: How the Source can/should mirror the scanned image data prior to transfer. Operation is performed in conjunction with ICAP_ORIENTATION and ICAP_ROTATION.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_PATCHCODESEARCHMODE
member.summary: Restricts patch code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_JPEGQUALITY
member.summary: Use this capability as a shortcut to select JPEG quantization tables that tradeoff quality versus compressed image size. Used in concert with DAT_JPEGCOMPRSSION it is possible for an Application to obtain the tables that are appropriate for varying percentages of quality within a given Source.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_COMPRESSION
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which compression schemes they have in common for Buffered Memory and File transfers.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_XFERMECH
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which transfer mechanisms the source supports.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.ICAP_UNITS
member.summary: Unless a quantity is dimensionless or uses a specified unit of measure, ICAP_UNITS determines the unit of measure for all quantities.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWEI_DESKEWSTATUS
member.summary: Returns the status of the deskew operation.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWEI_BARCODEROTATION
member.summary: The bar codes orientation on the scanned image is described in reference to a Western-style interpretation of the image.

member.name: T:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.LANGUAGE

member.summary: Turns automatic deskew correction on and off.

member.summary: Turns automatic border detection on and off.
member.value: Sets the value indicating whether [automatic border detection].
member.returns: Gets the value indicating whether [automatic border detection].
member.remarks: Set to null to use the current default setting.

member.summary: When TRUE this capability depends on intelligent features within the Source to automatically rotate the image to the correct position.
member.value: Sets the value indicating whether [automatic rotate].

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWCapabilities.IsDuplexEnabled
member.summary: The user can set the duplex option to be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, the scanner scans both sides of a paper; otherwise, the scanner will scan only one side of the image.
member.value: Sets the value indicating whether [duplex enabled].
member.returns: Gets the value indicating whether [duplex enabled].
member.remarks: Set to null to use the current default setting.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWCapabilities.DuplexTypeValue
member.summary: [READ ONLY] This indicates whether the scanner supports duplex. If so, it further indicates whether one-path or two-path duplex is supported.
member.returns: Indicates whether the scanner supports duplex.
member.remarks: This is a read only capability.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWCapabilities.IsFeederEnabled
member.summary: If TRUE, Source must acquire data from the document feeder acquire area and other feeder capabilities can be used. If FALSE, Source must acquire data from the non-feeder acquire area and no other feeder capabilities can be used.
member.value: Sets the use of document feeder.
member.returns: Gets the use of document feeder.
member.remarks: Set to null to use the current default setting.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWCapabilities.IsAutoFeedEnabled
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will automatically feed the next page from the document feeder after the number of frames negotiated for capture from each page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must be TRUE to use this capability.
member.value: Sets the use of auto feeder.
member.returns: Gets the use of auto feeder.
member.remarks: Set to null to use the current default setting.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.Twain.TWCapabilities.IsAutoScanEnabled
member.summary: This capability is intended to boost the performance of a Source. The fundamental assumption behind AutoScan is that the device is able to capture the number of images indicated by the value of CAP_XFERCOUNT without waiting for the Application to request the image transfers. This is only possible if the device has internal buffers capable of caching the images it captures.
member.value: Sets the use of auto cache feeder.
member.returns: Gets the use of auto cache feeder.
member.remarks: Set to null to use the current default setting.

member.summary: Gets or set the abort when no paper is detected.
member.value: Sets the abort when no paper is detected.
member.returns: Gets the abort when no paper is detected.

member.summary: If TRUE, the Source displays a progress indicator during acquisition and transfer, regardless of whether the Source's user interface is active. If FALSE, the progress indicator is suppressed if the Source's user interface is inactive.
member.value: Sets the show progress indicator value.
member.returns: Gets the show progress indicator value.
member.remarks: Set to null to use the current default setting.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.DeviceType
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The DeviceType property contains a device type and device subtype. The WIA service creates and maintains this property The device type and subtype are obtained from the driver's INF file of the device file. An application reads the DeviceType property to determine whether it is using a scanner, camera, or video device. For more information about INF files, see INF Files for WIA Devices. The StiDeviceTypeXxx constants are defined in Sti.h.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.DeviceID
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The DeviceID property contains the device identifier (ID) string for a WIA minidriver. The WIA service creates and maintains this property.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.VendorDescription
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The VendorDescription property contains a vendor description string for the WIA minidriver. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. The vendor description is obtained from the INF file. An application reads the VendorDescription property to get a description of the device vendor.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.DeviceDescription
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The DeviceDescription property contains the device description string for a WIA minidriver. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. The device description string that the DeviceDescription property contains is obtained from the driver's INF file. An application reads this property to get a description of the device.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.PortName
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The PortName property contains an installed device's port name, which is assigned by the kernel-mode driver that operates the device. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. An application reads the PortName property to determine the port name.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.DeviceName
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The DeviceName property contains the name of a device. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. The device name that is contained in the DeviceName property is obtained from the driver's INF file. An application reads this property to obtain the name of the device.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.ServerName
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The ServerName property contains the name of the server that a WIA minidriver is running on. The default value of ServerName is "local". This property should contain the string "local" when an application is connected to a device on the same computer. Versions:Optional for Microsoft WindowsXP and later operating systems.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.RemoteDeviceID
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The RemoteDeviceID property contains the device identifier (ID) of a WIA device that is installed on a remote computer. The WIA service creates and maintains this property.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.UiClassID
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The UiClassID property contains the vendor-supplied class identifier (CLSID) for any user interface (UI) extension COM object that is installed with a WIA minidriver. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. The UI CLSID value that is contained in the UiClassID property is obtained from the driver's INF file. If no UI CLSID is specified, the WIA service supplies a default value. This property is used only internally by the WIA service when UI is being displayed.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.HardwareConfiguration
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The HardwareConfiguration property indicates the type of connection that a device is using. The WIA service creates and maintains this property, and only the WIA service can change it. An application reads the HardwareConfiguration property to determine the device's connection type.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.Baudrate
member.summary: [READ ONLY] BaudRate The Baudrate property contains the current baud rate setting for a device. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. The value of the Baudrate property should be "Empty" if the device is not connected by a serial cable.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.WiaVersion
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The WiaVersion property contains the number (as a string) of the current WIA version that is installed on a computer. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. An application reads WiaVersion to determine the version of WIA that is installed on the computer. Versions:Available in Microsoft WindowsXP and later operating systems.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.DriverVersion
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The DriverVersion property contains the current DLL version of a WIA minidriver. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. If the WIA minidriver does not supply a version resource, the WIA service supplies the value "0.0.0.0" as a default. An application reads DriverVersion to determine the version of the WIA minidriver DLL. Note: Beginning with WindowsVista, the wildcard IP address 0.0.0.0 is not available. Also beginning with WindowsVista, if the IPAutoconfigurationEnabled registry key is set to a value of 0, automatic IP address assignment is disabled, and no IP address is assigned. In this case, the ipconfig command line tool will not display an IP address. If the key is set to a nonzero value, an IP address is automatically assigned. This key can be located at the following paths in the registry: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\Current Control Set\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\IPAutoconfigurationEnabled HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\Current Control Set\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces\GUID\IPAutoconfigurationEnabled Versions:Available in Microsoft WindowsXP and later operating systems.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.PnpID
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The current PnP id for the device. The WIA service creates and maintains this property. This property is available in Windows Vista and later.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.FirmwareVersion
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The FirmwareVersion property contains a device firmware version. The minidriver creates and maintains this property. The value of the FirmwareVersion property must be a string value, such as "1.0.4" or "1.0abc".

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.ConnectionStatus

The WIA minidriver creates and maintains this property. Versions:Beginning with WindowsVista, the HorizontalBedSize property is still available, but it has been replaced by the WIA_IPS_MAX_HORIZONTAL_SIZE property, so you should consider it optional.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.VerticalBedSize

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.VerticalSheetFeedSize
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The VerticalSheetFeedSize property contains the physical vertical dimensions of a scanner's document feeder, in thousandths of an inch (.001). member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.SheetFeederRegistration
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The SheetFeederRegistration property contains the registration, or alignment and edge detection, for documents that are placed on the flatbed of a scanner. The WIA minidriver creates and maintains this property. The SheetFeederRegistration property indicates how a document is horizontally positioned on the scanning head of a handheld or sheet-fed scanner. The scanner uses the property to predict where a user places a document on the scanning head. For scanners that support more than one scanning head, the SheetFeederRegistration property is relative to the topmost scanning head. This property is required for sheet-fed, scroll-fed, and handheld scanners. Versions:For WindowsVista and later operating systems, use the WIA_IPS_SHEET_FEEDER_REGISTRATION property instead.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.HorizontalBedRegistration
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The HorizontalBedRegistration property contains the registration, or horizontal alignment, for documents that are placed on the flatbed of a scanner. The WIA minidriver creates and maintains this property. Versions:Obsolete in WindowsVista and later operating systems and should no longer be used. However, this property is still defined in WindowsVista for compatibility with applications and devices designed for Windows Server2003, WindowsXP, and previous versions of Windows.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.VerticalBedRegistration
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The VerticalBedRegistration property contains the registration, or vertical alignment and edge detection, for documents that are placed on the flatbed of a scanner. The WIA minidriver creates and maintains this property. Versions:Obsolete in WindowsVista and later operating systems and should no longer be used. However, this property is still defined in WindowsVista for compatibility with applications and devices designed for Windows Server2003, WindowsXP, and previous versions of Windows.

member.name: P:ImageComponents.Core.Imaging.WIA.DeviceSettings.PlatenColor
member.summary: [READ ONLY] The PlatenColor property contains the current platen color. A minidriver should report the PlatenColor as a vector of four BYTE values in the form of an RGBQUAD structure (which is described in the Microsoft Windows SDK documentation). The WIA minidriver creates and maintains this property. An application reads PlatenColor to get the scanner's platen color. This color can help the application post-process the final image.
